name: Joshua Tang
about:
I have worked at the Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute for two years. I started as a Summer Scholar and completed a software testing project using the idea of Metamorphic Testing. I discovered some interesting results and had my first paper submitted and published to an international conference. I then developed an RNA-Seq analysis pipeline based on the results in my software testing project, which aims to lower the number of false negative results in the alignment process. After that, I implemented a tool that utilises cloud computing and machine learning to perform data mining and processing.

I have also worked as a Software Engineer at Timeweave to develop and maintain scripts that were used at the backend of the app. And I have worked as a Teaching Assistant at Code Camp. And lastly, I have spent some time developing bots on the messaging platform Telegram.

entries.title: Honours Student
entries.description:
- Developed GEOraclePlus using Python, Shell and R - a fully automated tool that utilises cloud computing and machine learning to perform data mining and processing on a large database
- Achieved a F1 score of ~0.93 for the trained text classifiers
- Increased the performance of the processing pipeline by 24x with the use of cloud computing when comparing to a semi-automated data mining and processing tool

entries.title: Summer Scholar
entries.description:
- Evaluated and tested Scavenger - an RNA-Seq analysis pipeline that we developed
- The pipeline was able to recover a portion of false negative results from the alignment results of RNA-Seq alignment tools based on previous findings using the idea of Metamorphic Testing
- Assisted with the case study for GEOracle - a tool to mine and process data on GEO and helped to construct a large organ-specific gene regulatory network

entries.title: Vocational Placement
entries.description:
- Developed Scavenger using Python - an RNA-Seq analysis pipeline
- Gathered and analysed results from the pipeline and helped with my supervisor's grant application

entries.title: Summer Scholar
entries.description:
- Completed a software testing project using the idea of Metamorphic Testing and Python
- Submitted and published a paper to an international conference to discuss about my findings in the project

entries.title: Software Engineer
entries.description: - Developed and maintained scripts that were used at the backend of the Timeweave app using Python and Docker

entries.title: Teaching Assistant
entries.description: - Worked as a team to teach and help kids to develop mobile games using block coding

entries.title: Replenishment Team Member
entries.description: - Worked effectively as a replenishment team member

entries.title: Volunteer
entries.description:
- Assisted to organise activities for kids during school holidays
- Helped kids to participate in the activities
- Taught and helped the elderly in the community to use their smart devices

projects.name: Telegram Group Guardian
projects.description:
- Telegram chat bot that filters photos with inappropriate content, and links and files that may contain malwares in groups
- Effective use of Google's vision and safe browsing APIs

projects.name: Telegram PDF Bot
projects.description:
- Telegram chat bot that allows users to manipulate PDF files
- Effective use of some of the different Python PDF libraries

projects.name: Telegram Big Two Bot
projects.description: - Telegram chat bot that allows users to play the game big two

projects.name: GEOraclePlus
projects.description: - Source code for GEOraclePlus, which is associated with the project when I was working as a Honours Student at Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute

projects.name: Scavenger
projects.description: - Source Code for Scavenger, which is associated with the project when I was at a Vocational Placement at Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute

projects.name: GenomeR
projects.description: - Source code for GenomeR, which is associated with one of the projects that I completed in BINF3111 - Bioinformatics Project A at UNSW

projects.name: Telegram Cognitive Bot
projects.description:
- Telegram chat bot that allows users to test with the cognitive services online
- Effective use of Microsoft's Cognitive Services APIs
